terms.name: Derivative
terms.description: The rate at which a function's output value changes concerning its input variable

terms.name: Integral
terms.description: The accumulation of quantities, often interpreted as the area under a curve

terms.name: Prime Number
terms.description: A natural number greater than 1 that is not a product of two smaller natural numbers

terms.name: Matrix
terms.description: A rectangular array of numbers, symbols, or expressions arranged in rows and columns

terms.name: Quadratic Equation
terms.description: A second-order polynomial equation in a single variable with the form ax^2 + bx + c = 0

terms.name: Exponential Function
terms.description: A mathematical function of the form f(x) = a^x, where 'a' is a constant greater than 0 and not equal to 1

terms.name: Complex Number
terms.description: A number of the form a + bi, where 'a' and 'b' are real numbers, and 'i' is the imaginary unit

terms.name: Vector
terms.description: An object that has both magnitude and direction, often represented as an arrow in Euclidean space

terms.name: Probability Distribution
terms.description: A mathematical function that describes the likelihood of obtaining the possible values that a random variable can take

terms.name: Geometric Progression
terms.description: A sequence of numbers where each term after the first is found by multiplying the previous one by a fixed, non-zero number

terms.name: Set Theory
terms.description: A branch of mathematical logic that studies sets, which are collections of objects

terms.name: Trigonometry
terms.description: A branch of mathematics that studies the relationships between the sides and angles of triangles

terms.name: Calculus
terms.description: A branch of mathematics that studies continuous change, involving derivatives and integrals

terms.name: Number Theory
terms.description: A branch of pure mathematics that deals with properties and relationships of numbers, especially integers

terms.name: Statistics
terms.description: A branch of mathematics that deals with the collection, analysis, interpretation, presentation, and organization of data

terms.name: Linear Algebra
terms.description: A branch of mathematics concerning linear equations, linear functions, and their representations through matrices and vector spaces

terms.name: Logic
terms.description: A branch of mathematics dealing with the study of reasoning and argumentation

terms.name: Geometry
terms.description: A branch of mathematics involving the study of shapes, sizes, properties, and dimensions of objects and spaces

terms.name: Number System
terms.description: A writing system for expressing numbers, including natural numbers, integers, rational numbers, and real numbers

terms.name: Graph Theory
terms.description: A branch of discrete mathematics that studies the relationships between edges and vertices in a graph

terms.name: Discrete Mathematics
terms.description: A branch of mathematics dealing with objects that can assume only distinct, separated values

terms.name: Differential Equation
terms.description: An equation involving derivatives, describing the rate at which a quantity changes concerning another variable

terms.name: Permutation
terms.description: An arrangement of objects in a specific order

terms.name: Probability Theory
terms.description: A branch of mathematics dealing with the analysis of random phenomena and probability distributions

terms.name: Hyperbolic Function
terms.description: Mathematical functions analog to trigonometric functions but based on hyperbolas

terms.name: Algebraic Equation
terms.description: An equation involving algebraic expressions, often polynomial equations

terms.name: Combinatorics
terms.description: A branch of mathematics concerning the counting, combination, and arrangement of objects

terms.name: Euler's Formula
terms.description: A mathematical formula expressing a deep relationship between complex exponentials and trigonometric functions

terms.name: Golden Ratio
terms.description: An irrational number often denoted by the Greek letter phi (Î¦), with interesting mathematical properties
